programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Bangkok, Thailand, has so many culinary treasures, it deserves a second trip! From steamed whole bass to massaman curry, Andrew highlights the city's exotic flavors and meals that are meant to be shared.

programme.title: Chimps of the Lost Gorge
programme.desc: A family lives in a deep, ancient forested gorge in Uganda, that runs through Africa's savannah, of which has been cut off from the rest of the jungle for 15 years.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet
programme.desc: In winter, lynx prowl the Yukon for snowshoe hares and manatees seek hot springs to escape the freeze. In summer, Tennessee fish build spectacular underwater pyramids, fireflies light up the forest's nights, and polar bears leap from rocks as they hunt.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet
programme.desc: A look at the most species rich continent on Earth: South America. In the Andes, pumas hunt guanaco while rarely seen bears search for mini avocados. In the Amazon, poison dart frogs care for their babies and colourful macaws eat clay.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet
programme.desc: Visit the planet's largest continent. In the frozen north, walrus congregate in extraordinary numbers, bears gather inside volcanoes and yeti-like monkeys fight in the remote forests of China. In the tropical south, the last few Sumatran rhino roam.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet
programme.desc: A land cast adrift at the time of the dinosaurs. Here, kangaroos and wombats brave snowstorms and gum tree forests are filled with never-before-seen predators.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet
programme.desc: Europe is where wildlife survives alongside people. In Gibraltar, a baby monkey is kidnapped, while in the cemeteries of Vienna grave robbing wild hamsters fight. In this fairy tale continent wolves roam the forests and dragons lurk in caves.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet
programme.desc: Even in Africa, home of the greatest wildlife gatherings on Earth, wildlife faces many challenges.

programme.title: Planet Earth: A Celebration
programme.desc: This program highlights eight of the most extraordinary sequences from 'Planet Earth II' and 'Blue Planet II.' In addition to new narration, the sequences will include an arrangement of original scores from composer Hans Zimmer and Jacob Shea.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rooted on the slope of a rocky hill in Namaqualand, South Africa stands The Namaqua Rock Fig Tree. with the ability to withstand the unforgiving conditions of the surrounding desolate landscape, and with minimal rainfall, it is a testament to survival.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: For some, remote islands offer sanctuary away from the mainland: the tiny pygmy three-toed sloth only survives because of the peace and safety offered by its Caribbean island home, while seabirds like albatross thrive in predator-free isolation.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: In this episode we climb high into the world's great mountain ranges. Only a few pioneering animals have what it takes to survive up here, they are amongst the most elusive and mysterious on the planet.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Jungles are the richest places on Earth. A magical world of surprise, drama and unforgettable wild characters. From the jungles of Brazil to Costa Rica, watch as the animals face life in the most competitive place on Earth.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: In this episode we visit the world's deserts, a land of extremes that pushes life to the limit. Animals here have developed ingenious ways of dealing with the hostile conditions giving rise to the most incredible survival stories on Earth.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Grasslands cover one quarter of all land and support the greatest gatherings of wildlife on Earth. The extraordinary creatures that live here must survive the most hostile seasons on the planet.

programme.title: Baby Chimp Rescue
programme.desc: At a home for rescued baby chimps in Liberia, couple Jim and Jenny Desmond teach the orphans the skills they would have learnt from their mothers in the wild. They rescue a new orphan called "Miracle" from her life on a chain.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes with each episode's production team, revealing the astounding challenges they encountered and their incredible experiences along the way filming Planet Earth II.

programme.title: Hidden Habitats
programme.desc: The Red Center of Australia is one of the most inhospitable environments on Earth yet it is filled with wildlife. The secret to Australia's diversity is its rainforest past.

programme.title: Hidden Habitats
programme.desc: The Great Barrier Reef's size is revealed as a mosaic of environments. However, scale isn't the only success of this micro world. The reef exists in nutrient poor waters, which on the face of it, is too poor to support all this life.

programme.title: Hidden Habitats
programme.desc: Steven Backshall investigates what make the Amazon so diverse. He looks at the nutrient poor nature of the rainforest and discusses the strategies used by the life in the jungle to make the most of the little nutrients available.

programme.title: Underworld: Blood Wars
programme.desc: Vampire death dealer Selene continues her struggle against the Lycans and Vampires that took everything from her. When she discovers the two factions are hunting her blood to become more powerful, she works to end the eternal war once and for all.

programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End

programme.title: Murder in the Heartland
programme.desc: A man is hysterical when he finds his brother's girlfriend and roommate beaten with an iron and stabbed to death on the floor. The brothers appear devastated, but the discovery of her missing phone casts doubt on their alibis.

programme.title: The Case of the Missing Footprints
programme.desc: When cops arrive at a snow-covered home in Chestnut Ridge, New York, they discover a young woman has been murdered. They are left to wonder if a set of footprints in the snow belong to their killer, and why there is only one set when there should be two.

programme.title: Murder in the Heartland
programme.desc: Successful business owner MaryAnn Clibbery is brutally murdered at the remodeling business she owned in Loves Park, Illinois. The murder shocks the town. Then a suspicious bag found floating on the ice in the river unlocks the mystery of her slaying.

programme.title: Murder in the Heartland
programme.desc: Aurora, Indiana hadn't seen a murder in decades until Leigh Jennings was killed in her own home. Residents are horrified when the beloved mother and hairstylist is found dead. In a case where everyone liked the victim, anyone could be the killer.

programme.title: Murder in the Heartland

programme.title: BTK: Chasing a Serial Killer
programme.desc: BTK announces his arrival by murdering four members of the same family. He claims more victims over several years while taunting police, then goes dark for two decades before resurfacing in 2004 after media stories claim that he'd been forgotten.

programme.title: BTK: Chasing a Serial Killer
programme.desc: A new generation of law enforcement hunts the resurgent BTK, who delights in communicating with police and the media about his murders while threatening new ones. He is finally arrested, bringing relief to Wichita but shock and horror to his family.

programme.title: BTK: Chasing a Serial Killer
programme.desc: Dennis Rader, aka BTK, confesses to ten murders and points police to the disturbing hoard of evidence against him. The depth of his depravity is revealed, along with the lasting effect he had on those in his orbit, most especially his own daughter.

programme.title: McMartin Preschool Trial: The Crimes That Changed Us
programme.desc: When the parents of children in a California preschool are informed that their kids may have been the victims of sexual abuse, it sets off a chain of panic and catastrophic events that will put an innocent man on trial for the heinous crimes.

programme.desc: Andrea Yates appears to have the perfect family. But when her fascination with extreme religious ideas and hidden postpartum psychosis lead her to believe Satan is sending messages, she drowns all five of her children, and a media firestorm ensues.

programme.title: Atlanta Olympic Bombing: The Crimes That Changed Us
programme.desc: At the 1996 Olympics, a security guard discovers pipe bombs and clears the area to minimize fatalities. Praised as a hero, the FBI then decides he fits the profile of a domestic terrorist, while the real villain continues his terror campaign.

programme.desc: After a taping of their local-access TV show in rural Vermont, Chrissy and Charlie Billis have a terrible accident, smashing their car into a tree. Only one survives. But tapes from the couple's TV show suggest a sinister tale behind what really happened.

programme.title: What on Earth?

programme.desc: Treasure hunters have searched for a lost Incan city of untold wealth for a century, but new technology might finally locate its riches. A strange mountain in Egypt sparks an investigation into Cleopatra's gems and the tomb of Alexander the Great.

programme.title: What on Earth?
programme.desc: New satellite evidence reveals a mysterious spiral structure from space, and experts speculate that it could be the lost city of Atlantis.

programme.title: What on Earth?
programme.desc: When satellites discover a strange abandoned city frozen in time, experts investigate what caused the people who lived here to disappear overnight. Using cutting-edge tech, they follow fresh leads to uncover if this mysterious city has a dark secret.

programme.desc: Meriwether Lewis was the man who teamed with William Clark to map the lands west of the Mississippi, but he died in mysterious circumstances. Experts reveal a vast conspiracy that could prove that one of America's greatest explorers was murdered.

programme.title: Unexplained and Unexplored
programme.desc: New evidence suggests the Maya civilization did not suddenly vanish, but that they instead still survived, they just resettled in the United States. Using cutting-edge tech, experts reveal what really happened to these long-lost people.

programme.title: Unexplained and Unexplored
programme.desc: New discoveries at the site of an alleged long-lost gold mine could lead investigators to a 200-million-dollar payday, and using cutting-edge tech, experts investigate clues in long-lost maps and relics to recover the Lost Dutchman's treasure.

programme.title: Unexplained and Unexplored

programme.title: Unexplained and Unexplored
